page.title: 02CHESTER-LE-STREET MARKET
page.content: The market is held in the market square at the bottom of the main street.It used to be held in the middle of the town but there is a Hintons supermarket there now.An excellent view of the green canvas canopies and milling crowds can be seen from trains passing over the viaduct.People come from all over the county to buy and sell goods.A survey which was made on the types of stalls in Chester-le-Street market showed that most stalls sell clothes.Others sell vegetables,fancy goods and dress materials.People are encouraged to buy things as they are cheap and mostly good quality.Most stall-holders are helpful.The market is held on Tuesdays and Fridays but is most popular on Friday afternoons.
